results.description:
Join us for Thursday's BSPUG meeting as we continue throughout 2016 to host an informative session featuring Dustin Sparks.

Encryption, Security and You
We've all heard about Encryption, and SSL, and HTTPS, and data leaks, and such and so forth.  But what does it all mean?  The depths are varied and nuanced, but it helps to know the terminology and the big picture, AND it's equally important to know that Encryption can't solve all problems. 


In this session, I cover the basics, and explain the many ways, despite our best intentions and precautions, it can all go wrong (and HAS).  

About Dustin Sparks

Dustin is the founder of Lexicon Informatics Consulting LLC and brings 20+ years of IT experience to clients, Consulting on Collaboration, Document Management, Data Systems, Information Security, and Process Automation using either custom developed solutions or based on vendor platforms. Currently focused on the SharePoint 2010/2013 Platform.

Dustin is partnered with DNA Solutions and Consulting, LLC for Federal consulting projects and initiatives.

Contact Dustin below:


@SparkDustJoe

Email: [masked]

About Baltimore SPUG:


The Baltimore SharePoint User's Group meets every third Thursday of the week at the ProObject building in Hanover, MD.

Each month, we host a guest speaker to deliver a SharePoint and/or Office 365 focused topic.

Keep in mind to watch @baltsharepoint on Twitter for updates on weather related information.

Parking is free and plenty of space is available

Discover 3 ways to improve your financial outlook at our next


MAIN EVENT 

 Special presentations by Gary Kenner, Mike Platte, and Bob Brendel  Join us at the Sheraton Baltimore North in Towson, Thursday, February 18, 6:30 to 9:00 p.m.  FREE admission for Baltimore REIA members.  Just $19 for guests.  

Want to make more money and protect it once you’ve got it?  This meeting is for you! Three local experts will share their wisdom with you. 

Gary Kenner on creative financing techniques 

Want to make more money?  Get creative with financing and do more deals!  Gary will address:

The key roles of a dealRisk vs. rewardAre there really no-money-down deals?Money or the deal: which comes first?Should you work with a partner — and if so, how do you find the right one?How personal strengths such as money, time, and talent can help you close a dealHow many ways you can finance a deal (hint: more than you think) 

Gary is a hard money lender and an instructor of our popular “All About Funding” class, coming up fast on February 20.  Attend our Main Event for a taste of what he offers in that class — including actual examples of creatively financed deals.

Mike Platte on identity theft 

Want to prevent hackers from plundering your hard-earned assets? Protect yourself against identity theft. Mike Platte will address:

What exactly is identity theft?How can you prevent it?Who investigates it once it happens?How to protect paperworkBeing stingy with your personal informationThe virtue of shredding

Mike has owned an insurance agency for nearly 40 years.  He also owns a company that teaches continuing education for insurance agents.  Let Mike teach you how to protect yourself against identity theft and potential financial disaster.

Bob Brendel on how to how to boost your bottom line at settlement 

Want to reduce or eliminate the largest line item on a settlement disclosure statement?  Bob will address:

Dozens of ways to legally transfer property without paying Recordation Tax or Transfer TaxHow this can save you up to 3% of the price of the property depending on jurisdiction — it could mean thousands of dollars!How to minimize taxes if they can’t be waived entirelyHow to do it all legally, by applying the tax laws most favorably to your transfer

Bob is the broker for RE/MAX Components, a title attorney, and past president of Baltimore REIA.  He has favored us with many presentations over the years.  Don’t miss this one if you want to see a bigger bottom line on your closing statements.

Plenty of time for your questions

After the presentations we’ll break into three separate roundtables.  You may choose to attend one, two, or all three to gain more info from the experts and get answers to your questions.

PLUS: our Success Story of the Month.  How about your story?

Like all of our Main Events, this one is FREE for Baltimore REIA members.

results.description:
Our February book is Go Set a Watchman by Harper Lee. From Harper Lee comes a landmark new novel set two decades after her beloved Pulitzer Prize winning masterpiece, "To Kill a Mockingbird".

Maycomb, Alabama. Twenty-six-year-old Jean Louise Finch - "Scout" - returns home from New York City to visit her aging father, Atticus. Set against the backdrop of the civil rights tensions and political turmoil that were transforming the South, Jean Louise's homecoming turns bittersweet when she learns disturbing truths about her close-knit family, the town, and the people dearest to her. Memories from her childhood flood back, and her values and assumptions are thrown into doubt. Featuring many of the iconic characters from "To Kill a Mockingbird", Go Set a Watchman perfectly captures a young woman, and a world, in painful yet necessary transition out of the illusions of the past - a journey that can only be guided by one's own conscience.

Written in the mid-1950s, Go Set a Watchman imparts a fuller, richer understanding and appreciation of Harper Lee. Here is an unforgettable novel of wisdom, humanity, passion, humor, and effortless precision - a profoundly affecting work of art that is both wonderfully evocative of another era and relevant to our own times. It not only confirms the enduring brilliance of To Kill a Mockingbird, but also serves as its essential companion, adding depth, context, and new meaning to an American classic.

Since our discussion is held at the Nordstrom Market Cafe, I plan on enjoying dinner during our discussion. Eating or drinking is optional but I certainly plan on enjoying something to eat and drink during our discussion. The Nordstrom Market Cafe is located on the second floor of Norstroms in the Columbia Mall.

results.description:
Hello all--

We're hitting up a mystery this month-- Strong Poison by Dorothy Sayers, a 1930 mystery novel. 

Sayers says of her creation, “I do not as a matter of fact remember inventing Lord Peter Wimsey . . . He walked in complete with spats and applied in an airy don’t-care-if-I-don’t-get-it way for the job of hero.” 

Wimsey stars in 14 of her novels; but, this one is the first where she introduces Harriet Vane, a star in her own right.  

Golden age of mystery writing here we come…

See you all on Thursday, February 18th.

Books in the shop. 

Reading rocks,

Jinny

Parking & Metro
The nearest parking garage:

www.silverspringdowntown.com has a good map of where are Panera Bread and the garage.


As Evelyn Leonard is no longer hosting this meetup- this meet up now has

TWO Co-hosts JOEL  (2nd THURS. )  & KEVIN (4th THURS) of each month

I am trying a new format for this meetup:

This format for the 2nd Thursday ONLY:

Each session should be divided into two groups. Each signer determines where they fit:

1st group: Fingerspelling & Flashcard and ASL books - in one group  (beginning/novice signers)

2nd group: Intermediate-Advanced/conversational (no talking, sign only)

Each person determines what there level is. As you make the transition to the second group-- please respect my one rule and be committed to really practicing ASL without using your voice. signing only.  The more you depend on your receptive skills, the more you will learn.

PLEASE INVITE YOUR DEAF FRIENDS, FAMILY and COLLEAGUES TO JOIN US!

THANKS,

JOEL and KEVIN

results.description:
Our first Mooji Sangha Satsang of many! Gather with us as we explore the teachings of a living master. Through experience you will see right HERE and NOW you are already free and One wth everything. There’s is nothing you must do to have this and Satsang is the place to reclaim it. Our Satsangs happen the first and third Thursdays of every month at Nourishing Journey.

Sangha is a Sanskrit word meaning ‘community’ or ‘assembly’. The Mooji Sangha is not made up of individuals, it is the one Being gathering as the many, called by the same voice, to recognize it’s innate unity. The goal of our gatherings is to celebrate the Truth of who we are - The Self and to dissolve the personal, which is the cause of all suffering. During Satsang we open up to the guidance of a True Master and welcome his grace to open our hearts to what is already always there.

cost: donations are welcome

If you want to learn more about Mooji's pointings watch this:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cgxGqINlh48

Watch this video from Mooji as he describes the value of Satsang and what it can bring to your life:</a>
<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OOv8LdCjTyo&feature=youtu.be">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OOv8LdCjTyo&feature=youtu.be

results.description:
Our next meeting will start at 7pm
Meeting address:
6425 Abel St
Elkridge MD 21075
[masked]

Our meetings are always free.

Our meetings are informal and we tend to discuss whatever anyone has brought with them to show as well as discussing local rockhounding ideas.

Even though we usually plan to wrap-up around 9pm, most of us are usually still chatting at 10. It is amazing the amount of knowledge that we share with each other and the body of knowledge that we have as a group. All of our meetings have been great (even when only a few show up).

I do ask that you RSVP for our meeting, but... if you haven’t RSVP'd and would still like to come to the meeting – please do. The RSVP helps the meeting by showing others that we do have a group and that there will be a meeting that night. If you RSVP’d yes and can’t make it, that’s OK too (you can always change your RSVP at any time).

I hope that you will consider attending (newbie or old-hand). Our group has been meeting for over 3 years now. We have over 150 total members and we’ve maintained a 5 star rating for our meetings. I believe that you will enjoy yourself and we will enjoy your company too.

As always, everyone is invited to our meetings (including your non-Rockhound guests). I have videos from Cash and Treasures shows that cover some great rockhounding locations and I will bring out some of my "treasures".

I hope you can make it, we are very informal, don't forget to bring someting (rocks, fossils, yard rock, book, map, whatever) to discuss.

Wayne Homens

Founder, 
Central Maryland Rock and Mineral Exchange Meetup

http://www.meetup.com/rockhounds

results.description:
Update 14 Feb 2015:

Here's more details & info about the weekend plan (same info I emailed):

Friday

I highly recommend driving during daylight hours & arriving at LakeStar Lodge before it gets dark. Leaving around noon is a good departure time from DC/Baltimore area as you'll arrive at check-in time and you'll miss rush hour in the Frederick vicinity. (You could also go earlier - leave around 10am to miss rush hour & arrive around 1pm and have lunch and then go to the lodge to check-in afterwards.)

Check-in time is 3:00pm. check-out is 11:00 AM.

All rooms have been paid in full, so nothing to do except go to the front desk to check-in and get your room key.

I'm working on the plan for the group to meet on Friday... this will likely be happy hour that rolls into dinner. This will give us the opportunity to meet up with each other and get organized with who wants to do what and the plan to do so. I'll email later this week with the final plan - locale & time.

Saturday

Once we know who is doing what activity, which we'll figure out at the Friday happy hour/dinner outing, we can break into respective groups on Saturday. For example, one group will be those who want to go to Wisp Report (for skiing, snowboard, tubing, ice skating, snowshoeing) that Dan will be leading and a group who isn't go to Wisp that I will be with.

In the next day or two, I'll make Saturday dinner reservations... will let you know when it's confirmed. If you think you'll want to opt out of this group dinner, please let me know.

Other Info

Make sure you pack appropriate winter/snow gear that you'll need for whatever activities you plan to do, e.g., warm, waterproof boots, gloves & pants... hat, scarf.

Feel free to bring drinks (alcoholic & non) and snacks in case you want them - for when we are hanging at the lodge. There is a liquor/wine/beer store and grocery store nearby.

There is wi-fi at the Lodge; coffee, tea & snacks in the lobby kitchen; and mini-fridge & microwave in the rooms.

My cell number is <a>[masked]</a>. Feel free to call or text me when you arrive on Friday. Note that cell service can be spotty depending on your service provider.

Update:  10 Dec 15: I everyone.  Please be sure to RSVP by January 12th, I will be releasing the rooms we don't need back to the hotel management by January 15th.  Thanks!  :)

BREAK....


Let's get together in February for a combined DC & Baltimore MeetUp back at Deep Creek Lake in Garrett County, MD.

We had such an awesome time this past August at LakeStar Lodge that we decided we should head back out and partake in Deep Creek's offerings of wintertime activities!  

Skiing, tubing, ice skating, or snowshoeing are just some of the activities you can choose to participate in during the winter months at Deep Creek.  The Lakestar Lodge is the perfect, central and convenient location to take advantage of the ski mountain or other activities (only 1 mile to WISP Ski Resort).  Or, of course you could just cozy up next to the fireplace with a hot beverage and soak up the relaxing/rustic atmosphere at the Lodge!  

Accommodations:  

As of now the entire lodge is on hold for our group!  All rooms are a two night minimum.  In order to RSVP you will need to pay your $100 deposit via the MeetUp Site.  Once you RSVP and pay your deposit message us with your preferred room option.  Please also let us know if you are coming solo, want a room on your own, or prefer to be matched up with a roommate.  We can then assign you a room.

See below for your room options and prices per night.  (Please note that each price listed does not include taxes!)

All rooms have private bathrooms, balcony's overlooking the lake and are tastefully decorated with cozy and rustic charm.  Check out their website at http://lakestarlodge.com/.  The Lodge underwent a total renovation recently so everything is new and quite comfortable! 

Room types available, just 21 rooms total:

- First floor, two queen beds for $153 per nite (x2 nights) (two of these rooms are pet-friendly)


- First floor, one king bed for $144 per nite (x2 nights) (one of these rooms is pet-friendly)


- Second floor, one queen bed with fireplace for $144 per nite (x2 nights)

- Second floor three bedroom suite (one bed in each room) with kitchen, living room and fireplace for $254 per nite (x2 nights)

Message us if you have any questions regarding your room options!  

Activities:

Deep Creek / Garrett County is the snowiest part of Maryland, with mountain elevations between 2,000 and 3,000 feet and average annual snowfall of 138 inches per year!  It is obvious to see why the Deep Creek area is very popular for wintertime fun.  Check out http://www.wispresort.com for all the winter activities they offer including skiing, snowboarding, ice skating, tubing and MORE!

Once we get a consensus of everyone's preferred activity we'll work out the details.  For instance, if there are 20 or more people who want to ski/snowboard we can work with WISP's group sales office to partake in discounted lift tickets, etc.  

Good to know info/sign up logistics:

- In order to RSVP for this event you will need to pay the $100 deposit through this MeetUp page.  

- We can only offer refunds of your deposit (minus MeetUp's fee's) up until January 1st!  (no deposit refunds will be issued after January 1st)

- Deadline to RSVP is January 1st.

- If you prefer to share a room we will do our best to match you up with someone else looking to share.

- Balance of room charges are due by January 15th, we will send you an invoice or link to pay via Paypal.

- We will post more details regarding group or individual activities, etc around January 15th!

- Driving to Deep Creek on a Friday afterwork usually involves some traffic around Frederick.  We advise folks to maybe leave work early that day and plan to meet around 5-6pm to check in, and then we can head out for a group dinner.

More fun stuff:

Oh, this weekend also happens to be the Deep Creek Dunk!  This event is a yearly tradition for 1000's of people to brave the freezing temperatures and enter the frozen lake for the sake of raising money for the Special Olympics! 

 Interested in participating???  Check out their Deep Creek Dunk website:   http://www.kintera.org/faf/home/default.asp?ievent=1142849

We hope to see you for our Winter Deep Creek MeetUp, message us with any questions!  :)
results.name: Local Ski Weekend at Deep Creek Lake for Wintertime Fun Activities!

results.description:
History Happy Hour: Lost Lagers: Recreating Historic BeersJanuary 22, 2016 @ 6:30 pm - 8:00 pm | $15.00


<a href="http://www.sandyspringmuseum.org/event/history-happy-hour-lost-lagers-recreating-historic-beers/"></a> Beer brewing traditions in North American date back to the days of the first settlers.  George Washington’s 1757 journals include a recipe for beer.  This historical subject cries out for our attention!  Enter the founders of Lost Lagers, Mike Stein and Pete Jones who have combined their skills in historic research and home brewing in order to recreate beers of the 18th and 19th centuries.

Use all of your senses to learn about history while you sample what historic beers taste like.  Bluejacket’s Table Ale, Strong Ale, X Ale, and 1812 Project Blend Porter will be poured alongside Lost Rhino’s Tmavy, Czech Dark Lager.

Mike Stein has been featured in Washington City Paper’s, “Lager Rhythms: How Homebrewer Mike Stein Revived Heurich’s Lager, a Classic D.C. Beer.”

 http://www.washingtoncitypaper.com/blogs/youngandhungry/2013/08/07/lager-rhythms-how-homebrewer-mike-stein-revived-heurichs-lager-a-classic-d-c-beer/
results.how_to_find_us: 17901 Bentley Road, Sandy Spring, MD 20860 (next to Urban Barbecue, across street from Christopher's Hardware
results.name: History Happy Hour: Lost Lagers- Recreating Historic Beers

Poetry Reading

You are invited to bring a short poem(s) about Life and Relationships. We will read the poems, discuss them and sing songs! If you choose not to share a poem, then feel free to come and listen.

Mehrdad Mizani, a self realized teacher who has been interviewed by " Buddha at the gas pump " will lead this discussion and sing songs.

Love offering for "The way of Heart" will be appreciated. 7:00 to 8:00 .... Potluck dinner (optional). If you wish not to participate in the potluck dinner, please arrive at 7:45.

8:00 to 8:05 .... Short guided meditation.

8:05 to 10:00 .... Poetry reading, discussion and singing.

10:00 to 11:00 .... Music, singing and socializing.

Park in the lower two lots (left of the driveway)

Feel free to bring house slippers. Blankets will be provided for your comfort.

“No matter how much someone wishes to love others, it’s simply not possible without growing the heart.When we understand that only a mature heart can be the source of true and constant love, we realize that it is imperative for us to learn how the heart is meant to grow. No matter what else we do, the primary focus of life – thoughts, words and actions- should be on the growth of the heart in all its different realms.As we grow in the realms of the heart, we become able to see, feel and understand people around us. Therefore, our relationships with others become deeper and more harmonious. As the heart grows, so does the love, and so does our ability to experience lasting happiness in all areas of our lives.” Mehrdad Mizani

To see a sample of Mehrdad's talk, go to the following links:http://batgap.com/mehrdad-mizani/
http://www.youtube.com/user/thewayofheart

results.description:
ASC's 'Three Sisters', directed by Donald Hicken, was just announced as a Helen Hayes Awards© Recommended play.

One of Anton Chekhov's most notable plays, The Three Sisters is a stark portrayal of a Russian family early in the 20th century.

The play has often been described as "the decline of the aristocratic and artistic elite coupled with the search for meaning in a modern world." But simply, Chekhov offers us three Prozorov sisters - Olga, Masha, and Irina and their brother Andrei - who are refined and cultured youth, raised in Moscow but stranded in a small and "lifeless" provincial town for the past eleven years. With the recent death of their father Colonel Prozorov, they await a return to Moscow where the elusive "good life" can begin again.

Chekhov's works (The Seagull, Uncle Vanya, The Cherry Orchard) are often seen as the last echo of a fading classic Russian literary tradition before Stalinism made "socialist realism" into a suffocating orthodoxy.

Chekhov, having been a product himself of an abusive broken home, had a keen understanding of trauma, human nature, dysfunction, and the irony of existence, which is expertly portrayed in this glimpse into the life of one tragic Russian family.

Tickets here $25-40. Also check Goldstar for discounts.
results.name: Theater: Chekhov's The Three Sisters

results.description:
Lecture Topic: Aquatic Insects of Mongolia

MES meeting at 8:00 pm; Lecture begins 8:15 pm.

Location: UMBC Bioscience Building -  Room 004  Find a campus map at: http://about.umbc.edu/visitors-guide/campus-map/.

Cost: FREE

Speaker: Dr. Jon Gelhaus is a Professor in the Department of Biodiversity, Earth and Environmental Science and Curator of Entomology at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Drexel University. Jon developed his interest in insects early on as a boy growing up in Sacramento, California. After earning a Ph.D. in entomology at the University of Kansas, Jon was selected as a postdoctoral fellow at the Smithsonian Institution before coming to the Academy in 1990, where he has served for over 25 years. He became a Professor at Drexel University in September 2012. Jon served three years as Vice President of the Biodiversity Research Group at the Academy, and six years as President of he American Entomological Society.

Jon is also a Research Associate of the Smithsonian Institution, Department of Entomology, where he serves to maintain and provide access to the C. P. Alexander Collection of Crane Flies for the scientific community.

Jon’s special interest is in the systematics, evolution and natural history of insects, specifically crane flies, a group important in aquatic and terrestrial habitats. Jon's research has taken him worldwide, particularly his work in Mongolia, spanning nearly 20 years and encompassing two National Science Foundation funded projects. He received the Khubilai Khan Medal from the Mongolian Academy of Sciences in 2013 for his work describing and documenting the aquatic insect fauna and applying this knowledge for water quality monitoring. He has published 70 papers on crane flies and other insects, including subjects in identification, systematics, ecology and general natural history.

Meet for Dinner before the Lectures

If you are interested in meeting for dinner before the lectures, you are invited to join the guest speaker and your fellow MES members at Kibby’s Restaurant and Lounge, “Home of Baltimore’s Best Shrimp Salad Sandwich.” Kibby’s is located inside the Baltimore Beltway at 3450 Wilkens Avenue, Baltimore, MD 21229, just 15 minutes from UMBC. Meet at the restaurant promptly at 6:00 p.m.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the University of Maryland at Baltimore County Bioscience Building, Room 004--one floor below street level.
results.name: Aquatic Insects of Mongolia - MD Entomological Society Meeting and Lecture

DJ Roland Clark House Music’s Songsmith /Producer/ Deejay and Vocalist Past Aliases: Digital Pimps, South Street Player, Urban Soul/Dark Clark/and his latest alter ego Jesus Jackson which pegged the 3rd season opening of Greys Anatomy song “ Running On Sunshine”: Roland Clark is also featured vocalist on many Fatboy Slim releases. His voice is sometimes described as wildly erotic, soulful, loving, and deep. and his Midas Touch seems to be constant: if you can get Roland on your track, its going to be magic. Roland also carved himself a nice slice of house music’s pie with his phenomenal deejaying and production skills. His contributions infuse many artists best works, including Bob Sinclair, Armand Van Helden's gorgeous "Flowerz." Not surprising, though it is another track blessed by the voice of Roland Clark. Quite simply, Roland Clark has carved-out his place in history as the voice of House Music. Quote: "If House is a nation, I Wanna Be President!" Roland sounds if need be compared would be much like a chameleon going from a soulful sultriness to a hard house and techno. He has been sometimes pegged as the Nate Dogg of house, or house music’s laureate.and most notable these days are his deejay skills and the way he gets the crowd begging for more well after the lights come on. results.description:
IMPORTANT - Please read - New location in Timonium Md. at 7 W. Aylesbury Rd

Lets give a hand at the Habitat for Humanity's new location, the Timonium ReStore. 

Our work on the 20th will involve preparations for the grand opening later in March.

Habitat for Humanity ReStores are nonprofit home improvement stores and donation centers that sell new and gently used furniture, home accessories, building materials, and appliances to the public at a fraction of the retail price. Habitat for Humanity ReStores are proudly owned and operated by local Habitat for Humanity affiliates, and proceeds are used to build homes, communities, and hope locally and around the world.

The coordinator is requesting that participants complete the following online application - https://www.vlogistics.com/ex/portal.dll/ap?
results.name: Let's lend a hand to Habitat for Humanity on February the 20th

results.description:
It's time that you learned Python

You are a successful and intelligent professional working in a non-technical field (marketing, policy, education, management). You know that is the future and you need to learn more about computers and coding, but online coding classes are too impersonal, and coding bootcamps seem intimidating.

In Shirtable's one-day Python Basics workshop you will learn the fundamentals of programming in Python, walking away with techniques for structuring and manipulating data to gain insights that would be tedious, time consuming, and often impossible from a spreadsheet.

To attend this meetup, please purchase a ticket and sign up at the [masked] Baltimore sign-up site. You will need a ticket via Eventbrite to attend.

results.description:
Want money for your first deal?  For more deals? For all the deals you can handle?  Learn how to get it with our this class: 

 “All About Funding”


Your instructors: Gary Kenner and Jack Kiley, local experts on multiple types of fundingSaturday, February 20, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Best Western Plus Hotel & Conference Center, 5625 O’Donnell Street, Baltimore, MD 21224 Sign up now, lock in your place, and save $100! Spouse or life partner may attend at no extra charge. If you took this class before, take it again for half-price.  Get the latest info and updated handouts. NO RISK! You have our no-questions-asked, 100% money-back guarantee. See below for details.
 

What kinds of deals could you do — and how many deals — if you were confident you could fund and close them?

Funding is all-important.  But what are your options for borrowing money?  How much will that money cost you to borrow?  And how can you convince lenders to work with you?

Let Gary Kenner and Jack Kiley show you the money — who has it, how to get it, and how to negotiate the terms — with their NEW class, “All About Funding.”  This comprehensive full-day class covers: 

The many ways to fund a deal, because deals are different and you can’t rely on just one strategy.


 Money or the deal: which comes first?


 How to fund rehabs: the purchase and the rehab costs.


 How to get short-term and permanent funding for buy-and-hold investing.


 How to qualify for a loan.


 The differences between hard money and private money.


 The pros and cons of different types of loans.


 How to get proof of funds, so the seller knows you can close.


 The types of financial institutions and which are best for your situation.


 Owner financing — yes, it’s possible!  And it’s the cheapest money available.


 How to identify a partner and work a deal with one. 

Also discover the power of self-directed IRAs: yours and other people’s.  Get your share of today’s $20 trillion pool of retirement funds.  You’ll learn:

How to open and/or contribute to your own self-directed IRA.


 How to borrow from other people’s IRAs for less than the cost of hard money.


 How to wholesale, rehab, and buy rental property with your IRA.


 The differences between a tax-deferred (traditional) IRA and tax-free (Roth) IRA.


 How to move other retirement funds into a self-directed IRA.


 How to start with $1,000 or less and grow your wealth fast.


 How to lend money to earn high interest.Plus, whatever you want Gary and Jack to address.  There will be time for your questions, so bring ’em and get answers from the experts. 


THIS CLASS INCLUDES AN EXTENSIVE HANDOUT, PLUS A FREE BONUS TO HELP YOU TAKE ACTION:

During the class you’ll build an application package to prepare you to speak to any investor — hard money lender, private lender, bank, or your grandmother — with confidence! 

About Gary Kenner. Gary has spent his entire career in real estate, has completed more than 500 deals, and has a diversified portfolio in four states. He is a hard money lender, commercial loan broker, and licensed realtor. Gary moderates the Strategies Harford meeting for Baltimore REIA.

About Jack Kiley.  Jack is a Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Certified IRA Services Professional (CISP), and partner in MidAtlantic IRA LLC.  He brings over 25 years of experience in public accounting, and he feels strongly about helping people self-direct their retirement.  Jack moderates the Strategies IRA meeting for Baltimore REIA.

About you.  This “All About Funding” class is all about empowering you.  Learn how to get the funding you need to boost your investing career.


Sign up now and SAVE $100 on our next class, on Saturday, February 20. 

Includes your spouse or life partner at no extra charge, with one set of handouts per couple. Registration starts at 8:30 a.m. Class is from 9:00 to 5:00. 


 Please note: $1 test-drive members are note eligible for member pricing on classes. 

Special half-price offer for previous attendees of this class:

A great way to pay early and save: use PayPal Credit for no payments and no interest if paid in full within 6 months.  Choose PayPal when you check out, then follow the instructions for PayPal Credit.  

 ***
Another reason to sign up now: our no-risk, 100% money-back guarantee.

We’re sure you’ll be impressed with this training, but it’s your opinion that counts.  At lunch time, if you decide the class isn’t worth every penny or simply isn’t for you, leave the course materials with us and get a full refund with no hassle.  Your risk is zero! 

***

Not a member of Baltimore REIA?  Join us and save on this class, other classes, and our 7 monthly meetings… save on everything you buy at Home Depot… and gain many other benefits.  A full year of membership is just $179. You even get a FREE welcome kit with $197 worth of DVDs!  Join Baltimore REIA now.

Questions about the class? Contact your presenters: 

Gary Kenner: [masked] or[masked]-4234. 

Jack Kiley: [masked] or[masked] ext 260. 

 This class is included in our new Inner Circle program, along with the one-on-one help our members have clamored for.  Check it out!

 www.BaltimoreREIA.com

results.description:
The Maryland Book Bank has provides new and gently used children's books to disadvantaged families in Baltimore. Their goal is to spark family reading at home by making sure there are plenty of books available.

Volunteers are needed to help organize books at the Book Bank. On days when the weather is favorable, volunteer organizers at the Book Bank often arrange for volunteers to work outdoors!

This event has been very popular with volunteers who work with children. An extra benefit of sorting books for the Maryland Book Bank is the nostalgia trip you'll experience when you see books that you just might remember from your childhood...!

For those who are interested, we may go to lunch at a nearby restaurant after this event.

How to find the warehouse:

The Book Bank is located at the rear entrance of The Baltimore Sun warehouse complex, where parking is available for all volunteers.

The Book Bank can be difficult to find, so be sure to follow the directions at

http://marylandbookbank.org/directions.html

The rear entrance on Guilford Road is a locked gate. In order to gain entrance, you will need to use the intercom on the left side of the gate and tell the guard that you're a volunteer for Maryland Book Bank.  In case the guard is not at the desk, we'll post a phone number for the Book Bank staff, who will come out to open the gate.

One of our volunteers has made a short YouTube video (about 1 minute in length) that might help you find the warehouse.  The video starts at the intersection of  N. Calvert St. and E. Centre St., goes through the back entrance gate on Guilford Ave, and ends at the door of the Book Bank warehouse.   This video can be found at http://youtu.be/I5cwEo_aKfQ .
results.name: Maryland Book Bank

results.description:
Ready to Ride?

You’re invited to join us on our Saturday morning beginner group ride from our Performance Bicycle store. 

Come and join our staff for some fun with our G.R.S. beginner outdoor ride. 

The ride will last an hour.  Bring your water bottle, helmet and a positive attitude.
results.name: Great Ride Series Beginner Ride

group.name: Performance Bicycle Great Ride Series: Columbia

venue.name: B&A Trail Ranger Station at Earleigh Heights

results.description:
All cyclists are welcome. Members, please wear your ChristianCycling jersey (either orange or white) for easy identification and uniformity. We host no-drop rides and include road cyclists who average 12-20 mph.

Unless otherwise noted, all regular S.P. rides start at 8am (April-November) and 9am (December-March) from the Baltimore-Annapolis Trail ranger station in Severna Park.

Wear a cycling helmet; bring plenty of hydration; pack nourishment; and carry an extra inner tube, inflation and a bit of cash for mid-ride rest stops or for emergencies.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for our orange and white ChristianCycling jerseys around the parking area or at the building.
results.name: S.P. Group Ride

results.description:
You’re invited to join our Saturday Morning, Intermediate group ride starting from and ending at our Performance Bicycle store. The ride is for Intermediate riders and those getting back on the saddle. The average pace will be between 14 and 20 miles per hour and the ride will last approximately 90 minutes. We’ll explore some of the local bike paths available to you and experience some residential riding as well. The ride leaves the store every Saturday Morning, 9:00 am and is a “No Rider Left Behind” ride. Come out and join our ride leaders, for some fun outdoors.

Bring a helmet, waterbottle, spare tube, positive attitude :)
results.name: Let's Go for an Intermediate Ride

results.description:
Come to the Cradlerock Community Center in Support of Healthy Families Howard County. There will be entertainment including musical guests, toddler/ baby yoga teachers, stories by Ms. Tanis, cupcakes from Kupcakes and Co. and more. Raffle prizes include donations made by Greenberries, Swellness Center, Kindermusik, and other generous donors. I am continually adding donations to the list as I acquire them.  This is a festival you do not want to miss. This is a very important event. Cost is $45 dollars per family  This is a fundraising event and 100% of donations go to Healthy Families Howard County. Please RSVP the total number attending from your family.  Please email me your name, phone number, email (super important so I can send you details as they unfold), number of adults(limit two can be caregivers or grandparents etc) and number of children (limit three know that activities are geared to 5 and under crowd.) Raffle tickets are $5 a piece additionally. You do not need to attend the event to purchase raffle tickets. Raffle tickets will be available for sale at the event also.

Tickets right now are only available online through meetup until further notice, still looking for another possibility for sales of tickets outside of meetup.  If you would like raffle tickets you can buy them direct from me at a meetup event or message me.  I'm hoping to find a place people can go to get tickets but still working on making those arrangements.

Tickets are non-refundable (there is no make up day due to inclement weather or unforeseen cancellation.)


Why Healthy Families Howard County-Read the story behind the cause.

Back in 2013 when I had my first child I had very uneventful doctors appointments all the way until 4 weeks before my due date when I went in for those final checks and they told me to check into the hospital and that they would be expecting me. My heart raced as I was so excited that I would be meeting my baby but so unprepared. I was low fluid I was told. We hadn't put the crib together and hadn't finished washing cloths or organizing things for the baby. Fortunately they sent me home after giving me extra fluids. But I only lasted three more days before they brought me back. At least this time we had the crib assembled and cloths washed and a hospital bag packed. But little did I think about the impact three weeks early can have on a child and how much added stress that places on a parent when there kid is not keeping up with other kids and not meeting milestones. There was a point when they sent us to Hopkins because my boys head measurements weren't increasing fast enough. Fortunately all was fine with his head. Riley was also an often sick child with several cases of pneumonia that sent us to the hospital because he couldn't breath and had reactive airway disease, similar to asthma. Riley has been lucky to be born in Howard County where there is so much support. He was born low tone which was why he was not making milestone markers. With the help of infants and toddlers which I recommend the support of for any mom he has grown out of physical therapy and has even recently learned to jump a very hard skill for a boy who has low tone. He has also tested out of needing speech therapy, and graduates out of infants and toddlers at age three which means no special education services are needed at this time. He has come a very long way. When I first talked to Judy (of Healthy Families) my boy was three months of age and I was told he was too big for the program. I was thinking how lost we were and how small he was. We took him to the library and because he was low tone and a floppy baby some parent said to me is he even aloud out of the hospital and laughed at me for even taking my three month old out of the house to the library. He was small having been born early and he was floppy having been born low tone. I actually never participated in Healthy Families Howard County. But wished I could have been a part of it as I really think with a boy like Riley I really needed it. So when I started the group because I had registered my three month old in the healthy families class which is not aloud (even though if we went by his due date he would have qualified for the program) I became some how included in the email list of moms. The first mom to touch base with me was Katie who was so encouraging. She is quiet and attended only a handful of meetups, but little is she aware that her one email started this whole meetup. I invited the entire group of moms from the email she sent me (which was all the moms in the healthy families program) to come to my meetup group since I could not come to there group. I was already a long time fan of meetup as a runner and member of a running group. So starting my own group was treading on familiar territory plus I am a teacher so leading is not so unfamiliar either. Starting with just those moms from Healthy Families and building from there I made it my mission to let every new mom know about the Healthy Families program, and have kept it a recurring meetup. I have networked with business partners that support healthy families such as Greenberries, the Yoga Center of Columbia, and Olenka School of Music. My main goal of this fundraiser is to ensure that other new moms do not miss this opportunity, as for me dealing with an early birth and so many issues I didn't even learn about the program until my boy was too old. My goal is increased awareness about the program for new first time moms (better advertising). Also to connect this meetup group with the program (don't know if this is possible yet or how.) But I believe in possibilities and this fundraiser is a start in making changes to better serve new moms from 90 days and onward through this meetup groups continuance beyond me. This year I gave birth to my 2nd and last child. Everett seems like superman after having a low tone baby, although looking at other children he seems more average. Because this is my last child I will not be a new mom or parent of a toddler forever but would like a place where moms could meet authentically to make lasting friendships to be a forever. I am still trying to make that real as I transition on with my life and my kids as they journey on ward. I don't want to forget those moments when I was a first time mom and don't want to forget those new first time moms that come after me as there will be more Riley's who need extra help, and their parents who need extra support. And I'm sure to any first time mom we all need support some days, although I'm finding as a 2nd time mom so soon (with still a very needy tot) we are just crazy at this point. Please support the mission of this group by supporting this fundraiser, and if you read this far, congratulations for being probably the only one and thank you.
results.name: Healthly Families Howard County Fundraiser

group.name: New Moms and Parents of Toddlers of Columbia MD

results.description:
Join Civic Works' Baltimore Energy Challenge, creating energy-saving kits for homeowners. The event will be held inside our warehouse, which can be cold, so please dress warmly.


The Baltimore Energy Challenge teaches low and no cost ways to save energy to Baltimore City residents, businesses, and schools. Our AmeriCorps members install energy and water conservation equipment in homes. Installations include programmable thermostat, energy-efficient light bulbs, low flow showerheads, pipe wraps, power strips, and more. Since 2007, Civic Works has made energy installations in over 5,000 homes and reduced energy use by an average of 636 kWh per house each year. The Baltimore Energy Challenge is a partnership between Civic Works, the Baltimore Office of Sustainability, and the Baltimore Community Foundation.
results.how_to_find_us: ENTERING THE BUILDING: Use the entrance facing West on the corner of Milton and Eager to enter. There will be someone there to escort you back to our warehouse from there. Call (443-869-2614) if you have any issues.
results.name: Create Energy-Saving Kits at Baltimore Energy Challenge

results.description:
Refresh and rejuvenate with a free community service initiative to introduce people to breathing & meditation techniques that have a calming effect on the mind and reduce stress. In this 60-minute interactive session, participants develop insight on how to reduce negative emotions - anger, regret, sadness, anxiety and fear - that eat up our energy and time putting an unnecessary burden on our efforts. This workshop is also an introduction to the Art of Living Course.

During the workshop participants will experience:


• Breathing techniques that increase energy and vitality


• A guided meditation


• The connection between our breath, emotions, mind, body & the Self


• Discussion about the tendencies of the mind

Participants will be introduced to tools to chart a new course to healthier, happier, stress-free living.
results.how_to_find_us: Please sign in with front desk, ask for Sid and ask them to direct you to the conference room
results.name: Free Mind and Meditation Workshop

results.description:
This photo safari is being offered through Washington Photo Safari.

You will need to register with them here: http://washingtonphotosafari.com/safari/16116

Water Drop photography is a true art form! No two images are exactly the same.
Learn how to set up your own mini-studio for water drop photography. It isn’t expensive. Join Reb as he teaches you the basics in water drop photography. Experiment with both low cost & high end setups. Each student will be able to use their own camera and take their own images to be processed. Bring your camera, tripod, and preferably a macro or long lens. Reb will demonstrate different types of lighting techniques. You will learn the results of what happens when milk (or cream) is substituted for water or when additives are added to the water. Experiment with colored water! See the difference in the splash in a shallow pan versus a deeper pan. Increase the size of the water drops and watch what happens.

Make sure you have a few large memory cards and extra batteries for your camera. Feel free to bring your own flash unit(s) to try. Using colored film, we’ll experiment with different colored light sources as well as changing the size or the water drops, the interval between the time the water drops, and when the camera fires.

After everyone has had a lot of time shooting, Reb will then teach you his processing technique for water drops. Feel free to bring along your laptop to work on your own images.

This safari will take place at Reb's Studio at 7965 Pipers Path, Glen Burnie, MD.
results.name: Water Drop Photography

group.name: Pictures that Pop Photo Training: Safaris-Workshops-Webinars

results.description:
***PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING YOUR DONATIONS OR A SMALL CASH CONTRIBUTION FOR THE BENEFIT OF UPSHUR LEWIS ANIMAL CONTROL FACILITY IN WEST VIRGINIA :)***


The shelter is in especial need of large Kong toys, collars, leashes, Chlorox Wipes and Chlorox, but can also use dog food, cat food, towels, blankets, and other related goods.  This facility makes every effort to adopt out their animals to good homes, and it receives no government funding.  Thank you in advance for your participation.

Note:  Please be able to walk at 2.5 miles/hour and be willing to keep up with the pack in order to complete the walk in the allotted time.

Saturday's high will be 59 degrees with partly cloudy skies.


We will START at Hopewell Park, follow the trail leading to Lake Elkhorn, walk all the way around it, then walk through the neighborhood forest back to the start point at the pool. It's 3 miles, all paved, flat (except for gentle slopes) and stroller friendly.  


Hopewell Park is accessible from Snowden River Parkway after you pass by Carved Stone/Starbuck's on the left (as you are approaching from Broken Land Parkway.)  It is a left turn onto Rustling Leaf.  Look for "Hopewell Pool" sign. The pool is the second right; turn in and park there.  We will meet there by the trail.  (Click the link above to "Hopewell Park" to view a map.)  

Please arrive a little early so the dogs can sniff & form a pack.  We will leave on time.

------------------------------------------------------------

Columbia Dogs on the Go provides a way for you to meet friendly people with Friendly Dogs on a voluntary basis. By replying "Yes" to this RSVP and attending this event, you acknowledge that:

•  You are responsible for your own safety and the safety of your dogs and any guests.

•  Your dogs are current on their vaccinations.

•  Your dogs will be kept on a leash (non-retractable) and under your control at the Meetup.

•  You will clean up after your dogs at the Meetup.

•  You will update your RSVP if your plans change.

•  You understand that the Meetup ends when the walk ends. (If you choose to meet other members at a restaurant, dog park, or other location, it is on your own time and not part of the Meetup event.)

results.description:
Welcome to Warrior Meditation! These meditation sessions are secular and available to anyone wishing to meditate. All experience levels are welcome. During this session, I'll be offering 4 rounds of 10 to 15 minutes of Shamatha Meditation (also known as Calm Abiding, or Mindfulness meditation). If you are new to meditation and you would like to discuss the technique one on one, please send me a message, and we can schedule time before meditation to go over the technique. After the meditation session we discuss the meditation experience, and also take in select readings from a variety of meditation masters. The focus on most of our reading sessions is about using what we learn in meditation in every day life situations. 

Cheers!

Terri

We'll bike the paved Baltimore/Annapolis Trail from Marley Station to Annapolis, about 15 miles with the last 4 miles on local roads. At Annapolis the group will select a cafe or pub for lunch.

results.description:
In the aftermath of the Battle of Sullust the Alliance was saddled with over a million prisoners. Due to limited resources and more pressing needs, the Alliance has turned over handling of these prisoners to SoroSuub Corporation that have converted mines and farms on Sullust's two moons into work camps. The prisoners were part of a fleet that orbitally bombarded the moon of Sulon killing millions of innocent citizens. The Sullustans have no compassion for their prisoners and conditions at these work camps quickly turn brutal and horrific. The PCs are prisoners and they will need all their wits to survive and possibly escape as remaining here is likely a death sentence.

John's Royal Guardsman is here and other PCs will be added, but this will be a rough scenario - not for the squeamish nor the indecisive.

results.description:
The twenty-first century is when everything changes. And you've got to be ready.

The Doctor Is In!  If you think "Fezzes are cool!" then this is the Discussion Meetup for you!

What? What? What?:

Dr. Who Discussion Meetup!

Where in the Whoniverse:

“Somewhere there’s danger, somewhere there’s injustice, somewhere else, the tea’s getting cold.”  and that place is Amazing Spiral: Books, Comics, Toys & More!

When:  January 24th from  12pm - 2pm  (come for whatever part you can, often people come at 12 or at 1 and leave and stay as their schedule allows).[Note: This is a time change from 2014, when we met from 1 -3pm]  Then every third Saturday from 12 to 2pm for 2015.  Please call Amazing Spiral if there is inclement weather to see if the group is meeting or not. Amazing Spiral[masked]

Topics: January - The Christmas Episode is on the agenda.  What is the regular agenda? Er..."I will explain later..."  But we are getting a projector that can be hooked up to a computer, so viewing "Stuff" will be on it!

Who: The Doctor is In!   Dr. Anthony Spencer, Heather Schneider and Driana Pearlman have all stepped into the Tardis to lead our erstwhile group.  We know this because we built the Tardis as part of Dr. Who Day on July 26th, 2014.  Having the Power of Three means that we will never have to cancel the group for lack of moderator!!!!!

Why:

"The twenty-first century is when everything changes. And you've got to be ready."

and because we all need a little (or a lot) more Who in our lives!

How:

In costume is welcome!

Don't worry if you have only seen a few episodes, even if those episodes were decades ago!  As long as you have an interest in Talking Who Talk then you are ready!

Please check out Doctor Who Anonymous on Meet up for more cool Who-Peeps!

Look for Spider-Man to find Amazing Spiral: Books, Comics, Toys, GAMES & More!

We are across from the Senator Theater and around the corner from Belvedere Square Market Shops.

Ample parking in the back and on the street.

results.description:
Hello Everyone, lets get back to something we all like- PARANORMAL ROMANCE! 

This month we're reading Cupcakes, Trinkets, and Other Deadly Magic by: Meghan Ciana Doidge. 

With a title like that, someone better offer to bring Cupcakes to this meetup because I'm going to be drooling the entire time!

Summary: If you’d asked me a week ago, I would have told you that the best cupcakes were dark chocolate with chocolate cream cheese icing, that dancing in a crowd of magic wielders — the Adept — was better than sex, and that my life was peaceful and uneventful. Just the way I liked it. 


That’s what twenty-three years in the magical backwater of Vancouver will get you — a completely skewed sense of reality. Because when the dead werewolves started showing up, it all unraveled … except for the cupcake part. That’s a universal truth.

======

Watch Felicia Day lead online discussion on the Vaginal Fantasy youtube page, or follow the group on the goodreads page!


If you're new to the group, don't be afraid to attend the meetup. We love meeting new booknerds and drink mimosas together.
results.name: February Meetup: Cupcakes, Trinkets, and Other Deadly Magic

Annapolis Tango is proud and excited to bring Rebecca Shulman for an entire weekend offering workshops for all: Beginner, All Level, Practicas, and Int/Adv workshops in addition to a very limited number of private lessons. 

REGISTRATION IS OPEN! For class descriptions, details and registration, visit http://www.annapolistango.com/special-events.html

Registration numbers may be limited so REGISTER NOW! 

(Note that you will NOT be able to register on Meetup. Sorry!) 

*Brief Schedule Overview*

FRIDAY, Feb 19th

Beginner Introduction to Tango Workshop + Talk (​7-10pm)

SATURDAY, Feb 20th

Workshop 1: Beginner: Back Ochos & Ocho Cortado (noon-1:45pm)

Workshop 2: All Levels, Pauses and Parada​ (2-3:45pm)

Practica with *Rebecca* (4-6pm)

SUNDAY, Feb 20th

Workshop 1: All Levels: Techniques for Pivots (noon-1pm)

Workshop 2: Int/Adv: Double-Times & Sincopas, for Milonga Traspie & for Rhythmic Tangos (1-2:30pm)

Workshop 3: Int/Adv: Cool Moves from the Dark Side (2:30-4pm)

ALL ending with a FREE PRACTICA (4-6pm)

--------------

She’ll be here in 3 weeks, 4 days!

About Rebecca:

Rebecca Shulman has been dancing tango full-time for over 20 years and is regarded by the international community as an expert with an encyclopedic knowledge of the dance and a gift for conveying it to her students.Beyond her supernatural tango-memory that is finely tuned to the subtleties of this dance, Rebecca has the one quality that every tango dancer wants more than anything: a lot of people love dancing with her: Men and women, leaders and followers, beginners to professionals, serious and playful, Argentines or not: all these partners find dancing with Rebecca to be somewhere between a lot of fun, and completely enchanting. Read her full bio at rebeccatango.com or annapolistango.com under Special Events.
results.name: A weekend with Renowned Guest Teacher, Rebecca Shulman

results.description:
Greetings Everyone!

Following our Saturday Warrior Mediation, we'll share a pot luck lunch at 12:00 and then go right into this meetup. 

This meetup involves listening to the audio version of Dzogchen Ponlop Rinpoche's book "Rebel Buddha" and then holding a discussion about the material afterwards. This book is a great entry point for westerners who are looking to understand the Buddhist path. It is pithy,  and adapted to our cultural understanding. Here is a brief description from Rinpoche about the contents of this book:

"There’s a rebel within you. It’s the part of you that already knows how to break free of fear and unhappiness. This rebel is the voice of your own awakened mind. It’s your rebel buddha—the sharp, clear intelligence that resists the status quo. It wakes you up from the sleepy acceptance of your day-to-day reality and shows you the power of your enlightened nature. It’s the vibrant, insightful energy that compels you to seek the truth."

We'll be playing the book from its audio version. But I also have 4 copies I can share with folks if you'd like a hardcopy for this session.

I look forward to seeing you!
Regards
Terri
results.name: Study and Discussion Group: Rebel Buddha

"Second Chance Saloon opened its doors in December 2008. The owners created a friendly neighborhood meeting place where you can eat well at a reasonable cost and hang out and socialize with friends and family.

The owners can go to their saloon any day and greet by name a dozen regulars who have welcomed them with open arms. Second Chance is not in an office and the owners walk the floor. The staff will know you by name or by the beer you drink. Second Chance is where you can have a drink and dinner and not have to hit an ATM afterward. People come from all over to dine on homemade bar food such as the Second Chance wings, fried pickles, and homemade barbecue.

Please stop by to enjoy a comfortable, friendly atmosphere, 18-ever changing beers on tap, 88 bottled beers, outdoor Cactus Bar & Patio, pool tables, darts, shuffleboard, pinball, a jukebox, and many flat screen televisions!"

This is a nice winter afternoon excursion that will get us out in the country to drink wine, eat pasta, and enjoy live music at Boordy Vineyards. There is no entrance fee, so we just show up and have a good time doing some of our favorite activities! 

Boordy Vineyards is a popular winery located just north of Baltimore near Cockeysville. On weekends during the winter and spring, Boordy features its Truck 'n' Tunes event from 1:00 to 5:00 pm with live music and a food truck to accompany their wines. They offer wine tastings for $5 and sell a variety of wines to drink in a warm and inviting setting. 

Full details, directions, and reviews below:

http://www.boordy.com/page-332904/Events-At-Boordy.html

http://www.yelp.com/biz/boordy-vineyards-hydes

This is an all types of weather event. However, I will send out an email if we need to change plans or cancel due to unfavorable conditions. I hope to see you there!

results.description:
Year of Yes: How to Dance It Out, Stand In the Sun and Be Your Own Person by Shonda Rhimes

With three hit shows on television and three children at home, the uber-talented Shonda Rhimes had lots of good reasons to say NO when an unexpected invitation arrived. Hollywood party? No. Speaking engagement? No. Media appearances? No. And there was the side-benefit of saying No for an introvert like Shonda: nothing new to fear. Then Shonda’s sister laid down a challenge: just for one year, try to say YES to the unexpected invitations that come your way. Shonda reluctantly agreed―and the result was nothing short of transformative. In Year of Yes, Shonda Rhimes chronicles the powerful impact saying yes had on every aspect of her life―and how we can all change our lives with one little word. Yes.

results.name: GCOM Carney

results.description:
Investigative reporter and Pulitzer Prize finalist Bryan Denson tells the riveting story of the Nicholsons - father and son coconspirators who deceived their country by selling national secrets to Russia.

Jim Nicholson was one of the CIA's top veteran case officers. By day he taught spycraft at the CIA's clandestine training center, The Farm. By night,he was a minivan-driving single father racing home to have dinner with his kids. But Nicholson led a double life. For more than two years, he had met covertly with agents of Russia's foreign intelligence service and turned over troves of classified documents. In 1997 Nicholson became the highest-ranking CIA officer ever convicted of espionage. But his duplicity didn't stop there.

While behind the bars of a federal prison, the former mole systematically groomed the one person he trusted most to serve as his stand-in: his youngest son, Nathan. When asked to smuggle messages out of prison to Russian contacts, Nathan saw an opportunity to be heroic and to make his father proud.

results.description:
***PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING YOUR DONATIONS OR A SMALL CASH CONTRIBUTION FOR THE BENEFIT OF UPSHUR LEWIS ANIMAL CONTROL FACILITY IN WEST VIRGINIA :)***

The shelter is in especial need of large Kong toys, collars, leashes, Chlorox Wipes and Chlorox, but can also use dog food, cat food, towels, blankets, and other related goods.  This facility makes every effort to adopt out their animals to good homes, and it receives no government funding.  Thank you in advance for your participation.

This Benefit Walk is for Slow Pokes AND Peppy Dogs!  There will be hosts for each speed.  Come and enjoy a nice, slow walk for your tiny, aged or slower walking doggy, and a regular pace walk for your peppy dogs.  


Saturday's high will be 59 degrees with partly cloudy skies.

Please look carefully at the instructions and map below to find out where to park and meet for the walk!

Lake Kittamaqundi, the downtown heart of Columbia. For many years, the path only went only part-way around the lake. But in the fall of 2014, the Columbia Association completed the circuit and we can now walk around the entire lake along a new paved path!

This walk is very flat, only one gentle hill, and 1.5 miles around. We'll pass by the People Tree, the lakefront stage, and long-established Columbia restaurants like Clyde's and Tomato Palace.


You will basically head for the new Whole Foods of Columbia (added in Fall 2014), across from the Columbia Mall. However, we will park and meet in the lower lot, down the hill, and to the right of Whole Foods (as you look at it from the front.) This is actually the parking lot for the new Haven on the Lake spa. Please park in the area furthest from the spa entrance, as shown on the map below, so that we are closest to the trail and won't get in the way of the spa clients.


SAFETY & COURTESY

Please arrive early, to allow the dogs time to sniff and form their pack. We will leave on time.  If you can't make it please change your RSVP promptly, or leave a comment.  We'll turn to the right on the trail (counter clockwise) so you'll know where to find us if you arrive late.  


Please bring water for yourself & your dogs.  We're trying to avoid sharing water on the trail to prevent the chance of spreading the New Dog Flu.


If you see joggers or bikers, please shout "ON YOUR LEFT" to keep the dogs safe from being trampled, and to protect others from tripping on our animals.

PLEASE READ:

Columbia Dogs on the Go provides a way for friendly people with friendly dogs to meet people with similar interests on a voluntary basis. By replying "Yes" to this RSVP and attending this event, you acknowledge that: 

•  You are responsible for your own safety and the safety of your dogs and any guests. 

•  Your dogs are current on their vaccinations.

•  Your dogs will be kept on a 6-foot fixed leash (non-retractable) and under your control at the Meetup.

•  You will clean up after your dogs at the Meetup.

•  You will update your RSVP if your plans change.

•  You understand that the Meetup ends when the walk ends. (If you choose to meet other members at a restaurant, dog park, or other location, it is on your own time and not part of the Meetup event.)

 Looking forward to seeing everyone again!  


                                                                       Photos by J. Ameen-Lee
results.how_to_find_us: Go BEHIND Whole Foods down the HILL.  Park  closest to the woods by the water near the trail.
results.name: Walk to Benefit Upshur Lewis Animal-Lake Kittamaqundi 2:00 pm

results.description:
Bmore Vegan and PEP Foods are running the Vegan Mac 'n Cheese SMACKDOWN in Baltimore on this Saturday, February 20th.


Proceeds will support PEP Foods’ work to make vegan living affordable and accessible to everyone, regardless of income.


They are still taking registrations for chef contestants until the end of the day Monday, Feb 15. $25 to enter as a chef. Do you make the best vegan mac 'n cheese? Register as a chef contestant! Chefs must register by close-of business on Monday February, 15th!!! Prizes include trophies, T-shirts and other merchandise, gift cards for local vegan businesses, and serious bragging rights. Categories are: People’s Choice, Best Overall Mac ‘n Cheese (1st, 2nd, and 3rd place), Best Gluten-Free Mac ‘n Cheese, Best “From Scratch” Mac ‘n Cheese, Most Like Grandma’s Mac ‘n Cheese, Best Decorated Table. And there's also supposed to be a whole foods/healthier category.


You can register as a chef or attendee. Or you can volunteer and get free entrance to sample the mac and cheese entries.

Preregister to attend as an attendee ($10 online/$15 at the door) or enter the competition at http://www.pepfoodsinc.com/fundraisers 

Kids 5 and under attend for FREE.


To Volunteer: Contact [masked] if you want to volunteer, and tell them Jason sent you. They need people for 3 shifts: 2-4pm, 4-6pm, 6-8pm. You can do 1 or more shifts. And they especially need people for the 6-8pm shift. I'll be volunteering throughout the day because I love what both of these groups do, and some of the PEP Foods folks run the Vegan Living Program in Baltimore which got me to go vegan last year.


Whether you like it velvety smooth and saucy, or baked with bread crumbly goodness on top, come on out to taste them all and cast your vote in this 100% vegan cook-off. I will be there volunteering throughout the day.


Other food items from PEP Foods will be available, as well as a variety of beverages, including juice boxes for kids.


And tell your friends about the event, which is a great way to get non-vegans curious, by sharing the Facebook event and inviting them: https://www.facebook.com/events/437789176431434/

Parking is on the street, or in a few lots nearby (1 only takes coins). Be aware of meters. There is a metered lot at 1130 Hollins Street, 2 blocks from the Urban Business Center. It fits 30 to 40 cars. And there is a HUGE paid LOT at 1 North Poppleton, 4 blocks from the space and fits MANY cars (its a university lot). Not sure about parking? The #1, #10 and #20 bus lines all come VERY close, if not within a block. And you can always UBER or LYFT going to and from the event, if you don't want to dealing with parking. Carpools are always a fab idea - ride together with friends, if you can!

results.description:
The city of Kintargo has a new lord-mayor, but he's not someone interested in maintaining that city's free spirit. Paracount Barzillai Thrune has placed the city under martial law, and his cruel proclamations and sinister plans for the city bode ill. 

Can a small group of heroes and would-be rebels stand against the might of the Thrice-Damned House of Thrune and the Church of Asmodeus and save their home town from being crushed under the boot of an infernal tyrant? Will one of Cheliax's most powerful inquisitors make the city his playground, or can the rebels known as the Silver Ravens rise up to bring a new era of freedom to the so called Silver City of Kintargo? Join the rebellion! Save Kintargo! DOWN WITH THRUNE!
results.name: Hell's Rebels Adventure Path

results.description:
Roger Voigt is a New Zealander, who, with his Australian wife and children, immigrated to the U.S. in 1989. Since that time he has worked as a Pediatric Surgeon at the University of Maryland, where he currently holds the position of Chief of Pediatric Surgery and Pediatric Urology. He is also the Surgeon-in-Chief of the University of Maryland Children’s Hospital.

Dr. Voigt’s interest in health has been greatly influenced by his wife’s beliefs and practices, and her persistent efforts to optimize the health of her family through whole-food-plant-based eating. Consequently, he is grateful to enjoy excellent personal health, while noting that many of his peers suffer with hypertension, hyperlipidemia, heart disease, cancer, arthritis, and other lifestyle-related conditions. When he’s not at work he enjoys cycling, yard work, computing and sound engineering. Dr. Voigt, and his wife, Gayle, have four grown children, and five grandchildren—to whom the legacy of good health is now being passed.
Please RSVP to [masked]
$10 donation requested for food.
results.name: Abundant Living: Observations of a Pediatric Surgeon - Dr. Roger Voigt

results.description:
This is the session that was originally scheduled for Sat Jan 23. It is now Sat Feb. 20 at the Catonsville Y from 7 - 9 PM. The skill session will be on bracing.

The people who signed up for the original session are automatically signed up for this one. If you can't make the new date, you'll get a refund.

The people on the wait list are: 1) Cindy G and 2) cyberfool.

When I figure out how to make an "official" waitlist, they be up there. In the meantime, I'll add you if someone drops out.

Everything else is the same.

Join us to learn and practice some critical sea kayaking skills this winter at the Catonsville YMCA. These skills sessions are being held in conjunction with - but as a separate activity from - the three rolling sessions at the Y.

Each skill session will last about 1.5 hours and there will be a different skill focus at each of the three sessions.


Feb 6 - T-rescue and multiple variations of the T

Feb 20 - Bracing
Mar. 5 - Advanced Rescues

What to Expect

The first session will focus on bracing. We'll learn a couple of different techniques for this skill, the purpose of which is to keep you from capsizing. (Not a bad thing to know how to do, right?)

We'll go through a step-by-step progression to make sure you have each of the critical components of bracing nailed down. We will then do a series of drills and exercises to help build automatic bracing into your muscle memory.

These sessions are a lot of fun and, since you'll be learning bracing, you can expect to make mistakes and get wet! But that's part of the fun too!

The skills instruction will be for 90 minutes. You will then have an additional 20-30 minutes of pool time to practice what you've learned, or practice other skills, or just chill out.

The classes are small with just four students. This insures that you will get plenty of attention during the session.

Rick Wiebush will be the instructor.

There will be two additional skills sessions for CKA members, on Sat. Feb. 6 and Sat Mar 5. (You will need to register for those separately if you want to do them.)

We usually go out to a local bar/restaurant afterwards.

Have a look at the low brace:

1. going over; 2. catch yourself with the blade; 3. hip snap to right the boat; 4) head dink



What you need

1. a boat that fits you reasonably well i.e. one that you do not slide all around in and fall out of as soon as you put the boat on edge. In general, rec boats are not real good for learning bracing, because they typically are too roomy and don't have a spray skirt. You can still learn the fundamentals of bracing with a rec boat but it's hard to get realistic practice.

2. A spray skirt that stays on the boat when you edge the boat. You can't learn to brace very well if your spray skirt comes off by itself every time you start to go over or if your boat starts to fill up with water when you edge it.

Note: if you don't have a good boat for learning these skills, you can rent one from Chuck for just $15 for the two hours.

3. Warm clothing if you get cold easily. The pool is heated but some people get cold after spending so much time in the water. If you get cold easily it might be wise to wear some type of wet suit, like a farmer john or jane.

4. A change of clothes. There are lockers and showers available.

5. It is helpful is you already know how to do a wet exit. But if not, that is the very first thing you'll do at these sessions.

Cost and Payment

The cost for these sessions is $45. Here's how that breaks down: $20 for the pool + $5 for insurance + $20 for the lesson. $20 for a 90 minute skills lesson is a great price. Add $15 if you need a rental.

You must pay when you register. Pay via Pay Pal here.

Refunds will only be available if there is a waiting list and someone actually takes your spot. However, there will be a $10 administrative fee for any refunds.

You will be sent a reminder and more detailed information a few days before the class.

Answer the questions

In order to register you must also answer three questions:

1) what's your email address? This is so Rick or Chuck can communicate directly with you.

2) do you need to rent a boat?

3) do you know how to do a wet exit?

Getting on a Wait List

We want to have a wait list but that function isn't available on Meet Up when you have to pay to RSVP. So, if this is class is full and you want to get on the wait list, send an email to Rick at [masked]. He'll let you know if a space opens up.

RSVPing for Subsequent Skills Classes

The second skills session (T rescues and variations) will be on Saturday Feb. 6. You can RSVP for that after 6 PM on Sat. Jan. 9.

The third skills session (Advanced Rescues) will be on Saturday March 5. You can RSVP for that after 6PM on Sunday Jan. 10.
results.name: Skills Sessions at the Catonsville Y

results.description:
This the rescheduled rolling session that was originally scheduled for Sat. Jan 23.  This is the only other date we could get. The people who signed up and paid for that session are automatically signed up for this one.

If you can't make the new date, let Rick know ([masked]) and he'll take your name off the list and get you a refund.

The time is still 7 - 9 PM. Plan to get there at 6:45. Rick will send other details during the week immediately before the session.

Everything else is the same.

____________________________________________

Rick Wiebush of Cross Currents Sea Kayaking has been able to get a limited number of pool sessions for CKA members this winter. These sessions are designed to help you learn to roll or improve your existing roll. They will be taught by ACA certified instructors (Mike Hamilton and Tom Malone) who are expert rollers and very supportive teachers.

The classes will be held at the Catonsville YMCA on Saturday Jan 23 from 7 - 9 PM.

What to Expect

The rolling instruction will be for 1 hour 15 minutes. You will then have an additional 45 minutes of pool time to practice what you've learned, or practice other skills, or just chill out.

The classes are small with just three students for each instructor. This insures that you will get plenty of attention during the session. Enrollment is limited to six people.

Rolling isn't something that most people learn to do with just one lesson. So it would be best to expect that you won't actually roll. However, you will get the basic mechanics and components of your roll. Then it is a matter of a lot of practice and probably additional instruction. There will be two additional rolling sessions for CKA members, on Sat. Feb. 6 and Sat Mar 5. (You will need to register for those separately if you want to do them.)

We usually go out to a local bar/restaurant afterwards.

What you need

1. a boat that fits you i.e. one that you do not slide all around in and fall out of as soon as you turn upside down, In general, rec boats are not good for learning to roll.

2. A spray skirt that stays on the boat when you go upside down. You can't learn to roll if your spray skirt comes off by itself every time you go over.

3. Warm clothing if you get cold easily. The pool is heated but some people get cold after spending so much time in the water. If you get cold easily it might be wise to wear some type of wet suit, like a farmer john or jane.

4. A change of clothes. There are lockers and showers available.

5. A positive attitude and a view that it is ok to not succeed on your first set of attempts.

6. It is helpful is you already know how to do a wet exit. But if not, that is the very first thing you'll do at these sessions.

Note: If you want to learn to roll but don't have the right kind of boat, Chuck can make a couple of appropriate boats available.  The rental fee is just $15 for the two hours (spray skirt included).

Cost and Payment

The cost for these sessions is $55. Here's how that breaks down: $20 for the pool + $5 for insurance + $30 for the lesson. $30 for a 75 minute rolling lesson is a fabulous price.  Add $15 if you need a rental.

You must pay when you register. Pay via Pay Pal here.

Refunds will only be available if there is a waiting list and someone actually takes your spot. However, there will be a $10 administrative fee for any refunds.

You will be sent a reminder and more detailed information a few days before the class.

Answer the questions

In order to register you must also answer three questions:

1) what's your email address? This is so Rick or Chuck can communicate directly with you.

2) do you need to rent a boat?

3) do you know how to do a wet exit?

Getting on a Wait List

We want to have a wait list but that function isn't available on Meet Up when you have to pay to RSVP.  So, if this is class is full and you want to get on the wait list, send an email to Rick at [masked]. He'll let you know if a space opens up.

RSVPing for Subsequent Classes

The second rolling session will be on Saturday Feb. 6. You can RSVP for that after 6 PM on Sat. Jan. 9.

The third rolling session will be on Saturday March 5. You can RSVP for that after 6PM on Sunday Jan. 10.

results.description:
In life we spend a lot of time learning, getting educated, building careers but how often do we take time to educate ourselves about our own mind?  Rarely does anyone teach us how to manage our mind. MY Reboot does just that!

MY Reboot is a 1 day interactive workshop, from 9am - 5pm, which gives your whole system an opportunity to take a step back and look at itself getting some deep rest. This workshop helps the participants understand their own mental conditioning, patterns and inhibitions which create limitations and boundaries. MY Reboot allows us to take a plunge into the ocean of freedom, beyond these limitations.

The sessions will include:


1. Low Impact Yoga


2. Yoga Nidra


3. Pranayama Breathwork


4. Meditation Mudras


5. Guided Meditations


6. Breakfast and Lunch


7. Processes to get a better understanding of our own mind


7. Laughter and Smiles :-)

Date: 2/21


Time: 9am - 5pm

To get an official spot you need to register here and pay the $50 fee: http://imeditatebmore.weebly.com/my-reboot.html
